conclusion: Separate the parts that carry current inside the magnetic field
Inside the uniform field there are three kinds of conductors: straight diameter MN, semicircular arc MQN, and two vertical side-legs
Work out the currents in the two parallel branches MN and MQN
Resistance is proportional to length, R₁ : R₂ = 2 : π
Let the battery supply an emf V
Current in MN is I₁ = V / R₁ and current in MQN is I₂ = V / R₂
I₁ / I₂ = π / 2, therefore I₂ = (2/π) I₁
Ampère force on the straight diameter is given
Force on MN is F₁ = B I₁ L₁ = B I₁(2 r), given as F
B I₁ 2 r = F
Ampère force on the semicircular arc
Element dℓ = r dθ, |dF| = B I₂ dℓ = B I₂ r dθ
Direction: dℓ is tangential, B is into the page, dF is radial
Vector sum over the half-circle is F⃗₂ = B I₂ r (0 î + 2 ĵ) = 2 B I₂ r ĵ
Magnitude of the force on the arc is F₂ = 2 B I₂ r
Forces on the two vertical side-legs
Currents are equal and opposite; magnetic forces cancel
Total force on the whole frame is F_total = F₁ + F₂
Using B I₁ 2 r = F and F₂ = 2 B r (2/π) I₁ = (4/π) B I₁ r
F_total = F + (2/π) F = F (1 + 2/π) = F (π + 2)/π
